alert.note: Alert for City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 19 at 4:48PM EDT until July 19 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR THE CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH... At 447 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Princess Anne to near Back Bay, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of the City of Virginia Beach, including the following locations... Oceana, Rudee Heights, Sigma, Sandbridge Beach, Dam Neck, Oceana NAS, Munden, Macons Corner, Pungo and London Bridge. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
